page.title: 17Stan Laurel of Ulverston
page.content: Stan Laurel is Ulverston's most famous son. He was the smaller of the comic duo{Laurel & Hardy}which graced the cinema screens during the 1920s and 1930s. Stan Laurel was born on the 16th June 1890 at 3 Argyle St. Ulverston, and for this reason a Laurel & Hardy museum was established in the town in 1975. Many admirers of the duo's unique talents belong to the worldwide Laurel & Hardy appreciation society the "Sons of the Desert",a title taken from the 1933 film of the same name. International conventions of the "Sons of the Desert" take place regul- arly,the fourth having taken place in Stan's home town in 1984. This event attracted many visitors to the town, particularly from America.
